com.bluegosling.reflect

Class ArrayUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bluegosling.reflect.ArrayUtils

  • public final class ArrayUtils
extends Object
    Utility methods for dealing with arrays, including primitive arrays.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • newInstance

        public static <T> T[] newInstance(Class<T> elementType,
                                  int len)
        Constructs a new array of the given non-primitive component type and length. This is a convenient wrapper around Array.newInstance(Class, int) that provides a more useful return type for reference component types: no cast required.
        Parameters:
        elementType - the type of elements in the new array
        len - the length, or capacity, of the new array
        Returns:
        a new array with the given component type and length, initially filled with all nulls.

      • clone

        public static <T> T clone(T array)
        Clones the given array object. This is useful when the object is known to be an array, but its concrete type (e.g. an array of reference types vs. a byte[]) is not known.
        Parameters:
        array - an array
        Returns:
        a clone of the given array

      • asList

        public static List<?> asList(Object array)
        Returns a view of the given array as a list. If the given array has a non-primitive component type then this is the same as using Arrays.asList(Object...). This version, however, can also be used with primitive array types. If the given array is a primitive array type then the returned list will be a PrimitiveList specialization for that type.
        Parameters:
        array - the array
        Returns:
        a view of the given array as a list
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given object is not actually an array

      • asList

        public static PrimitiveList.OfBoolean asList(boolean... array)
        A primitive specialization of Arrays.asList(Object...) for primitive boolean arrays.
        Parameters:
        array - an array of booleans
        Returns:
        a list view of the given array

        public static PrimitiveList.OfByte asList(byte... array)
        A primitive specialization of Arrays.asList(Object...) for primitive byte arrays.
        Parameters:
        array - an array of bytes
        Returns:
        a list view of the given array

      • equals

        public static boolean equals(Object array1,
                             Object array2)
        Determines if the given two arrays are equal, as determined by comparing their contents for equality. This provides a convenience above and beyond similar methods in Arrays because it accepts any array type, including primitive array types.
        Parameters:
        array1 - an array
        array2 - another array
        Returns:
        true if array2 is an array of the same type as array1 and has equal elements
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if array1 is not actually an array
        See Also:
        Arrays.equals(Object[], Object[])

      • hashCode

        public static int hashCode(Object array)
        Computes a hash code for the given array based on its content instead of on its identity. This provides a convenience above and beyond similar methods in Arrays because it accepts any array type, including primitive array types.
        Parameters:
        array - an array
        Returns:
        a hash code for the given array based on its content
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if array is not actually an array
        See Also:
        Arrays.hashCode(Object[])

      • toString

        public static String toString(Object array)
        Constructs a string representation for the given array that describes its contents (as opposed to the default Object.toString() version that arrays inherit). This provides a convenience above and beyond similar methods in Arrays because it accepts any array type, including primitive array types.
        Parameters:
        array - an array
        Returns:
        a string representation for the given array that describes its contents
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if array is not actually an array
        See Also:
        Arrays.toString(Object[])
